intro: Sonchus macrocarpus, commonly known as the giant sowthistle, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its large, broad leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and its yellow flowers that bloom in composite flower heads. The plant is native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa but has been introduced to other regions, including North America. It thrives in disturbed soils and can be found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Sonchus macrocarpus is an annual herb that can grow up to 1.5 meters tall, with a taproot system that allows it to survive in various environmental conditions.
